osSpec.py

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 #!/usr/bin/env python
00002 
00003 import sys
00004 import os
00005 import logging
00006 import ConfigParser
00007 
00008 ## OS-specific definitions for invoking graphviz/dot, and config file contents.
00009 # This started out as a 2-line config file and has grown into one with multiple sections.
00010 # This object tries to load the file and parse it into internal variables and abstract
00011 # configuration for parent objects that use them.
00012 #
00013 # @file osSpec.py
00014 # @author Paul Hubbard 
00015 # @date 1/12/09
00016 
00017 ## osSpec handles the configuration file and OS-specific stuff.
00018 class osSpec:       
00019     ## External dot program
00020     dotCmd = 'dot'
00021     ## Command-line parameters for dot
00022     dotParams = ''
00023     ## Filename of configuration file
00024     configFile = 'defaults.cfg'
00025     ## Hostname running INDS exMan
00026     indsHostname = 'localhost'
00027     ## hostname running inds viewer
00028     viewHostname = 'localhost'
00029     ## Graph colors, indexed by command ID
00030     colors = dict()
00031     ## Edge colors, ditto
00032     edgeColors = dict()
00033     ## Hexadecimal version of MD5 sum of XML configuration document, used as cache signal
00034     hexDigest = ''
00035     
00036     ## Constructor does all the work!
00037     def __init__(self):     
00038         # Anything windows-specific
00039         if os.name == 'nt':
00040             logging.debug('OS is NT, no paramaters set')
00041         if os.name == 'posix':
00042             logging.debug('OS is POSIX')
00043             
00044             # uname only works on posix systems
00045             longName = os.uname()
00046         
00047             logging.debug('uname is ' + longName[0])
00048     
00049             # OSX requires specifying where to find TimesRoman
00050             if longName[0] == 'Darwin':
00051                 self.dotParams = '-Nfontname=/System/Library/Fonts/Times.dfont'
00052                 logging.debug('Font name param set for OSX')
00053             else:
00054                 logging.debug('Other POSIX OS, no params set for dot')
00055     
00056         # Let config file override defaults
00057         config = ConfigParser.ConfigParser()
00058         fn = config.read(self.configFile)
00059         if fn:
00060             logging.debug('config file %s opened ok', self.configFile)
00061             
00062             # Where to find dot
00063             if(config.has_option('dot', 'dotcmd')):
00064                 logging.debug('dot is: ' + config.get('dot', 'dotcmd'))
00065                 self.dotCmd = config.get('dot', 'dotcmd')
00066                 
00067             # Command-line options for dot  
00068             if(config.has_option('dot', 'dotparams')):
00069                 logging.debug('dotparams are: ' + config.get('dot', 'dotparams'))
00070                 self.dotParams = config.get('dot', 'dotparams')
00071                 
00072             # Hostname for INDS
00073             if config.has_option('inds', 'hostname'):
00074                 self.indsHostname = config.get('inds', 'hostname')
00075                 logging.debug('inds hostname is ' + self.indsHostname)
00076                 
00077             # Hostname for indsViewer applet
00078             if config.has_option('inds', 'viewhost'):
00079                 self.viewHostname = config.get('inds', 'viewhost')
00080                 logging.debug('inds viewer hostname is ' + self.viewHostname)
00081                 
00082             # Checksum of cmdList from last run 
00083             if config.has_option('inds', 'last-run-checksum'):
00084                 self.hexDigest = config.get('inds', 'last-run-checksum')
00085                 logging.debug('Loaded last checksum: ' + self.hexDigest)    
00086                 
00087             # Load up colors for each node type 
00088             cmdTypes = ['source', 'sink', 'server', 'plugin', 'converter']
00089             for x in cmdTypes:
00090                 if config.has_option('dotcolors', x):
00091                     self.colors[x] = config.get('dotcolors', x) 
00092                     
00093             # Load up colors for each each edge type
00094             for x in cmdTypes:
00095                 if config.has_option('edgecolors', x):
00096                     self.edgeColors[x] = config.get('edgecolors', x)        
00097         else:
00098             logging.warn('Unable to open configuration file %s' % self.configFile)
00099         
00100     ## This updates the saved MD5 digest in the configuration file. 
00101     def updateHexDigest(self, hexDigest):
00102         config = ConfigParser.RawConfigParser()
00103         fn = config.read(self.configFile)
00104         if fn:
00105             logging.debug('config file %s opened ok', self.configFile)      
00106             config.set('inds', 'last-run-checksum', hexDigest)
00107             configfile = open(self.configFile, 'w')
00108             if configfile:
00109                 config.write(configfile)
00110             else:
00111                 logging.error('Unable to update checksum in configuration file!')
00112             
00113 ## Test harness 
00114 if __name__ == '__main__':      
00115     logging.basicConfig(level=logging.DEBUG, \
00116                         format='%(asctime)s %(levelname)s %(message)s')
00117     try:
00118         me = osSpec()
00119 
00120         logging.debug(me.colors)
00121         logging.debug(me.edgeColors)
00122         
00123     except BaseException, e:
00124         logging.exception(e)
